name: Build Request pre-epic [20] Archer - Shard RPG.
author: Barbagallo

posts.author: Barbagallo
posts.content:
Hello Guys. This forum is well done and full of useful advice.
I'm playing on a shard RPG pre epic level in Ravenloft.
I'd like to play an archer.
The classes that I like are Ranger / Rogue / Fighter. It's possible to make a good build?
Someone help me? Preferably Human because the elves are not welcome.

Thank you so much!!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content: Well, I think Mick Dagger is the man for the job. Mick, care to step up?

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Just a few thoughts. Ravenloft is a lvl 1-20 PW with a lot of changes to feat distribution and even the skills and how they work. It is a RP server with a lot of vere-creatures and undead. I don't remember enough from the special rules to be able to come up with a build tailored to the PW. And I know that a normal build will not be optimal there. The environment is rather low magic and even an item with +1 attack bonus can be hard to find early on. When I played there, it was more for the roleplay (believe it or not).

If I should make an archer, I would try to build something with AA in it. I know you don't want to play as elf, but half elf has the human phenotype and you can rp being a 1/4 elf or something, trying to hide your lineage.

posts.author: Barbagallo
posts.content:
Thank you guys.
Yes Mick, it's a server FULL RPG, and it's really difficult. There are a few magical weapons, and there are those that are hard to find. But it is not important.
Not many changes were made to the talents, to allow everyone to play.

Half-Elf is ok. I will try to hide the ears.

Thank you so much!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I'm thinking Bard 6 / Fighter 4 / AA 10, but lets see what Mick comes up with first.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Empyre, why not Bard 4 Fighter 6 AA 10? That way you get an extra feat and +1 BAB.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: You'd get fewer Bard skill dumps and a lesser Bard song and fewer Bard spells, but you might be right anyway.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:You'd get fewer Bard skill dumps and a lesser Bard song and fewer Bard spells, but you might be right anyway.
The bard song effects you "get back" by just going Fighter and you get them all the time instead of just when singing. Except for saves, but really.

I've NEVER had problems with 4 pre-epic skill dumps. More than that is just being greedy, and TBH, I wouldn't waste any stat points on Charisma to cast bard spells at such a low caster level unless they are leftovers and I REALLY have nowhere else to put them. In this build Bard is just a "tool" for skill dumps and to give access to AA. Can you build it, please? Just so I don't have to. I'm really lazy right now

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Very nice build Empyre.

I would take this even further though and go for a (Fighter 8/ Bard 2/ AA 10) build, replacing the last feats with WF: Rapier, WS: Rapier, IC: Rapier and take KD with the extra feat from Fighter.

You have room to make this character a pretty good melee warrior as well a deadly archer. I have seen what AA's can do in pre-epic PW's, and they are nothing sort of devastating.
